selected_quotes: Brown beige fat cells secrete an enzyme that tacks lipids on to amino acids = directly activating thermogenesis
Aycl-amino acids uncouple mitochondria to burn fat
Our paper w/Spiegelman lab at Dana Farber on PM20D1 that regulates acyl amino acid uncouplers is out in Cell!
An enzyme that adds lipids on to amino acids. The N-acyl amino acids activate thermogenesis
BAT secrets PM20D1, an enzyme that adds lipids to amino acids. These directly activate mitochondrial thermogenesis

citation.abstract: Brown and beige adipocytes are specialized cells that express uncoupling protein 1 (UCP1) and dissipate chemical energy as heat. These cells likely possess alternative UCP1-independent thermogenic mechanisms. Here, we identify a secreted enzyme, peptidase M20 domain containing 1 (PM20D1), that is enriched in UCP1(+) versus UCP1(-) adipocytes. We demonstrate that PM20D1 is a bidirectional enzyme in vitro, catalyzing both the condensation of fatty acids and amino acids to generate N-acyl amino acids and also the reverse hydrolytic reaction. N-acyl amino acids directly bind mitochondria and function as endogenous uncouplers of UCP1-independent respiration. Mice with increased circulating PM20D1 have augmented respiration and increased N-acyl amino acids in blood. Lastly, administration of N-acyl amino acids to mice improves glucose homeostasis and increases energy expenditure. These data identify an enzymatic node and a family of metabolites that regulate energy homeostasis. This pathway might be useful for treating obesity and associated disorders.
citation.title: The Secreted Enzyme PM20D1 Regulates Lipidated Amino Acid Uncouplers of Mitochondria

news.title: Researchers identify calorie-burning pathway in fat cells: Findings show potential for obesity treatment
news.summary: Investigators at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in collaboration with scientists at the University of California, Berkeley, have identified a natural molecular pathway that enables cells to burn off calories as heat rather than store them as fat.

news.title: Researchers identify calorie-burning pathway in fat cells
news.summary: Molecular pathway in brown and beige fat cells allows them to burn off calories instead of storing them as fat.

news.title: Calorie-Burning Pathway in Fat Cells Helps Treat Obesity
news.summary: A natural molecular pathway that enables cells to burn off calories as heat rather than store them as fat might be a new possibility to treat and prevent obesity, diabetes, and other obesity-linked metabolic disorders including cancer.

news.title: Researchers Identify Calorie-burning Pathway in Fat Cells

news.summary: Parvenir à déclencher, au repos, la combustion des graisses (ou des cellules adipeuses) serait finalement une solution idéale pour le traitement de l’obésité.

news.title: Forcing Fat Cells to Burn Calories
news.summary: With beach season in full swing, many folks would like the idea of having lipid cells be switched on to burn calories instead of storing them as fat.

news.title: Identifican una vía de quema de calorías en las células adiposas
news.summary: PUBLICADO EN 'CELL' JANO.es · 04 julio 2016 00:09 El hallazgo plantea la posibilidad de un nuevo enfoque en el tratamiento y la prevención de la obesidad, la diabetes y otros trastornos metabólicos relacionados con la obesidad, entre ellos el cáncer.

news.title: Obésité: Des scientifiques découvrent une enzyme brûleuse de graisses
news.summary: Nouvel espoir dans le traitement de l’obésité. Des chercheurs de l’Institut du cancer Dana-Farber, à Boston, et de l’Université de Californie, à Berkeley (Etats-Unis), viennent d’identifier une enzyme brûleuse de graisses.

news.title: Obésité : découverte d'une enzyme qui brûle les calories
news.summary: Les animaux possèdent plusieurs types de tissus adipeux : un tissu adipeux blanc, qui stocke des graisses, et un tissu adipeux brun, qui produit de la chaleur.

news.title: Obésité : découverte d'une enzyme qui brûle les calories
news.summary: Des chercheurs ont identifié une nouvelle enzyme (PM20D1) qui permet de brûler des calories et de produire de la chaleur dans les cellules, au lieu de stocker de la graisse.

news.title: Obésité : découverte d’une enzyme qui augmente la dépense énergétique
news.summary: ENZYME. Une équipe américaine rapporte avoir identifié une nouvelle voie enzymatique qui permet aux cellules graisseuses (adipocytes) de dissiper l’énergie sous forme de chaleur plutôt que de stocker les calories.
